flawed_nl_solution:
If John is 30 and twice as old as Maya then Maya is 30 / 2 = <<30/2=51>>51 years old
Drew is 5 years older than Maya so Drew is 51 + 5 = 56 years old
Peter is 4 years older than Drew so is 56 + 4 = 60 years old
In 2 years, Peter will be 60 + 2 = <<60+2=62>>62 years old
Half of Peter's age in 2 years will be 62 / 2 = <<62/2=31>>31 years old and Jacob's age in 2 years
Jacob now is 31 - 2 = <<31-2=29>>29 years old
#### 29

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
